intro: Aetheolaena longepenicillata, commonly known as the long-peninsula grass, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in grasslands and wetlands. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
